Description: Rim and bowl sherd (mended from three fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis; glazed largely fired orange-brown; interior and rim glazed; exterior: glaze band at top of wall; below, black-figure decoration consisting of female figures; possible trace of one at left; upper body of another in peplos with added red decoration, facing right and holding a staff topped with a rosette with red; facing her, part of head and upper body of third figure in red decorated garment; incised rosettes and crosshatching as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: On dating, see Möller 2000, 226 on the Polos Painter and his Circle. Venit suggests that the sherd joins British Museum 1965.0930.806, but it does not; however, they do probably belong to the same vase.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 334, no. B390)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 151, note 67, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0769) (Phase 1)
